user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of expire_sessions:
```c
static void
expire_sessions (void)
{
  struct Session *pos;
  struct Session *prev;
  struct Session *next;
  time_t now;

  now = time (NULL);
  prev = NULL;
  pos = sessions;
  while (NULL != pos)
  {
    next = pos->next;
    if (now - pos->start > 60 * 60)
    {
      /* expire sessions after 1h */
      if (NULL == prev)
        sessions = pos->next;
      else
        prev->next = next;
      free (pos);
    }
    else
      prev = pos;
    pos = next;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
now = time (NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the code fragment calls the standard library function time(), not expire_sessions, so there is no direct or indirect self-call (recursion). This would only violate Rule 17.2 if the identifier time resolved to a user-defined function that (directly or indirectly) called expire_sessions, which is not the case in the shown code.
